meanings.definition: To remove calcium deposits from something.
meanings.sent1: I am decalcifying the showerhead to make it work better.
meanings.sent2: She is decalcifying the kettle to prevent mineral buildup.
meanings.sent3: The decalcifying process turned into a fun science experiment for the kids.
meanings.sent4: Decalcifying the old pipes was like chipping away at ancient stone.
meanings.sent5: After decalcifying the coffee maker, it looked brand new.

meanings.definition: The process of removing calcium from a substance.
meanings.sent1: The decalcifying of the water was necessary for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: He learned about the decalcifying of bones in his biology class.
meanings.sent3: The decalcifying of the milk made it taste strange.
meanings.sent4: The decalcifying of the soil revealed hidden minerals underneath.
meanings.sent5: The decalcifying of the rock formation took years of erosion.
